Privacy Policy

Last updated: 07/2025

Introduction

This Privacy Policy (“Policy”) governs the processing of personal data that the data subjects (“Users”) provide to Deco Plataforma Digital (hereinafter referred to as “deco”) while using the deco platform (“Platform”) and interacting with the applications, tools, and features made available through the Platform (“Services”). 

Here, you will find information on how and which personal data or information we collect, how it is used, shared, and stored, and your rights in relation to such data. Therefore, before providing us with any personal data or using the Services, you must read this Policy in full. By using the Platform, in whole or in part, you acknowledge and accept this Policy.

This Policy is part of the Platform’s Terms of Use, available at Deco - Terms of Use, which must be carefully read and accepted as a prerequisite for the use of the Services. This Policy applies to deco’s products and services associated with the Platform. Any third-party services or applications will be governed by their own privacy policies, which must be read independently.

Collection of Personal Data

For the purposes of this Policy and in accordance with applicable laws, personal data means any information that identifies the User or allows their identification, pursuant to the Brazilian General Data Protection Law (Federal Law No. 13.709/2018 or “LGPD”). Anonymized or aggregated data are not considered personal data.

All data requested by deco are related to the provision of the Services and are used to improve the Users’ experience, ensure the continuous development of the Services, and enable new partnerships and associations that deco may establish in the future that benefit the provision of the Services.

Deco may collect the following data to enable access to and use of the Platform:

  • Access data: identification data necessary to enable access to and use of the Platform, such as the User’s name, email address, and other identification information that may be required and/or provided directly by you, or through the linking of accounts with third-party services that allow access to the Platform.

  • Data related to the use of Services: information or content created and shared by Users on the Platform, including but not limited to text prompts, data inputs to AI models, outputs generated by models (responses), and the history of conversations with AI agents, as well as information about the performance and use of different AI models (e.g., GPT, Sonnet, Gemini, Grok, Perplexity). We also collect information on the use of Services and User interactions with the Platform, including those captured by deco during monitoring of Service usage or at any time, data about the location of your IP address, network connection type, browser, operating system, and related data, or any data generated from interactions between Users and the Platform.

  • Financial data: data regarding authentication and financial transactions necessary for the acquisition of credits and use of the Services, such as payment information, credit card details, bank transfer or PIX information, or related data.

  • Other data: additional information beyond the above, within the form and limits of the consent you have granted (when consent is required), in accordance with this Policy and the Terms of Use, and as permitted by law.

Deco may collect personal data and information in the following ways:

  • Data shared by Users with deco: data regarding access, information, or files that Users input into the Platform while using the Services, or personal data necessary to enable communication between Users and deco regarding questions, requests, or complaints.

  • Data provided by third parties: data related to Users that are shared or made available by third parties, for example, when necessary to allow the User to access the Platform or to promote the Services.

  • Usage and browsing data on the Platform: information collected while you use the Services, for example through cookies and other similar technologies, including data relating to the use of Services.

  • Public data: data related to Users that are publicly accessible or made public by the Users themselves. The processing of such data will consider the purpose, good faith, and public interest that justified their availability, within the limits permitted by applicable law.

Processing of Personal Data

Deco values Users’ privacy and uses the personal data collected for the following purposes:

  • Ensure the proper functioning of the Platform, allow User registration and access, enable the provision of Services, improve the Platform, and develop new features, technologies, and enhancements for the Services, through statistical techniques, data cross-referencing, and machine learning, including training and improvement of underlying AI models (where applicable and permitted by law/contract with model providers), analysis of AI agents’ performance, and optimization of conversational workflow generation. Deco does not use your data from interactions with AI models to train or improve third-party underlying models (GPT, Sonnet, Gemini, etc.), unless you explicitly consent to this for the purpose of personalization or improvement of your own use of the Platform.

  • Investigate and monitor Users’ use of the Services, including, if necessary, requesting or collecting new information to identify and determine improper, unlawful, or non-compliant uses that violate the Terms of Use or applicable law.

  • Supervise, at any time, Users’ interactions with interactive screens and other Platform features, including detailed logging of interactions and tracking of consumed tokens, to ensure that the use of the Services complies with the Terms of Use and applicable law, and for internal audit and cost optimization purposes.

  • Analyze and resolve technical and security-related issues of the Services, as well as conduct risk assessments and enable fraud prevention, within the necessary scope to ensure the integrity of the Platform.

  • Enable the purchase of credits required for the use of the Services and regulate the consumption of such credits during the User’s interaction with the Platform.

  • Enable the promotion of deco’s commercial initiatives, within the limits permitted by law, and provide personalized experiences, direct marketing of new Services or features of the Platform, through appropriate channels and within the permitted limits, and for cost-benefit (ROI) analysis, A/B testing of AI models in production, and automatic optimization for more efficient models, always aiming to improve the quality and efficiency of the Services.

  • Fulfill legal or regulatory obligations, including obligations set forth in the Terms of Use, to enable the provision of Services under the agreed conditions and in compliance with applicable law.

  • Respond to requests from public authorities, courts, or arbitral tribunals, when necessary for deco’s defense, where required or mandated by law, judicial, administrative, or arbitral decisions.

  • Other lawful purposes, within the scope and limits of the corresponding consent granted by the User (when consent is required), and within the limits of applicable law.

Sharing of Personal Data

To enable the provision of the Services and ensure the proper functioning of the Platform, deco may, always in compliance with applicable law, transfer personal data provided by Users or collected during the use of the Services to deco’s commercial and operational partners.

Deco may share personal data and information for the following purposes:

  • Assist in the provision or operation of the Platform and Services, in cases where sharing Users’ personal data and information with service providers is necessary (e.g., storage of information in cloud servers).

  • Enable and enhance the Services provided by deco, respecting the purposes described in this Policy and in compliance with the Terms of Use, while ensuring the same levels of security set forth herein.

  • Analyze and resolve technical, fraud, and security-related issues of the Platform.

  • Defend deco or respond to requests from judicial, administrative, or arbitral authorities (e.g., court order, search warrant, or subpoena), if deco believes in good faith that it is necessary to do so or if required by law or judicial, administrative, or arbitral decision, and allow compliance with legal and regulatory obligations, sharing personal data with competent authorities strictly to the necessary extent.

  • Other lawful purposes, within the scope and limits of the corresponding consent granted by the User (when consent is required), and within the limits of applicable law.

If a request is received from a public authority requiring access to information stored by deco, the User may be notified to take appropriate defense measures, except where deco is legally prohibited from doing so due to a legal request or order from a competent authority.

Cookies

Technologies such as “cookies” — small data files — pixel tags, device identifiers, and storage may be used during the User’s use of the Platform, to transmit, secure, and understand activities and advertisements, within and outside the Services, as well as to allow deco to present the most relevant content to Users, improve the Services, and maintain the Platform’s security levels.

Cookies may be used for specific purposes, such as (i) understanding how the User interacts with the Platform; (ii) customizing the Platform according to User preferences; (iii) measuring the Platform’s usability; and (iv) managing and improving the Services provided and ensuring they function correctly.

If the User does not wish to provide the information obtained by cookies, the User may manage browser or device preferences to disable them. The User acknowledges that disabling certain categories of cookies may result in improper or partial functioning of the Platform’s features.

Third-Party Services and Activities

The Platform may provide interaction with third-party products or services, whether through links, offers, or advertising of partners’ services or products, which have their own terms and policies. However, this Policy is limited exclusively to the Services offered by deco through the Platform.

It is the User’s responsibility, before using systems, applications, websites, and platforms of deco’s partners, to carefully read their respective policies. Deco has no responsibility or control over the processing of personal data carried out by its partners or any third parties.

Storage and Security of Personal Data

When processing Users’ personal data, deco will strive to store and keep it secure, in compliance with applicable law. For this reason, in offering the Platform and Services, deco is committed to continuously implementing physical, technical, and administrative information security measures in the processing of Users’ personal data, to protect such data against unauthorized access, accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, disclosure, or any form of improper or unlawful processing.

The information security measures adopted by deco are guided by applicable legislation, industry best practices, and deco’s internal policies related to the matter, including the use of our deterministic MCP (Management and Control Plane) layer to ensure secure and auditable access to internal systems, and the “Zero DevOps” architecture that helps minimize vulnerabilities.

Access to and processing of Users’ personal data by deco’s employees or third parties will be limited to what is necessary for the provision of Services, and will occur under deco’s express instructions, with confidentiality obligations and contractual safeguards in place.

Deco will only retain your personal data when necessary for the purposes described in this Policy and as long as there is a legal basis to retain them, including to allow the exercise of deco’s contractual and legal obligations and rights.

International Transfer of Personal Data

Deco, as a company aligned with the most current practices and technologies, may carry out international transfers of personal data collected during the provision of the Services, in order to enable the activities described throughout this Policy (for example, storing data in cloud storage services with servers located abroad, such as part of Cloudflare’s global infrastructure, which may involve processing and storage of data in data centers located in different countries).

Deco is committed to carrying out international transfers of your personal data only based on mechanisms permitted by applicable law. In such cases, deco undertakes to adopt all necessary measures and techniques to ensure the security and protection of your data.

In cases where Users’ consent is required, deco will seek to obtain specific and prominent consent for such activity, reinforcing the international nature of the operation, as well as distinguishing the purpose justifying the transfer.

Data Subjects’ Rights

Deco will adopt appropriate technical and organizational measures to fulfill its obligations regarding the rights granted to Users as data subjects. In this regard, deco undertakes to make every effort to enable the exercise of your rights as provided by law, including:

  • Confirmation of the existence of processing;

  • Access to data;

  • Correction of incomplete, inaccurate, or outdated data;

  • Anonymization, blocking, or deletion of unnecessary, excessive, or unlawfully processed data;

  • Portability of data to another service or product provider, upon express request, in accordance with ANPD regulations, subject to commercial and industrial secrets;

  • Deletion of personal data processed with the data subject’s consent, except where applicable retention cases are provided by law;

  • Information on the public and private entities with which deco has shared data;

  • Information on the possibility of not providing consent and the consequences of refusal;

  • Withdrawal of consent: the right to revoke consent at any time, through an express statement, by a free and facilitated procedure.

The withdrawal of consent may prevent the User from using specific features of the Platform or, depending on the case, may render access to deco’s Services impossible.

  • Petition regarding your personal data against deco before the ANPD;

  • Objection to processing carried out based on a legal basis other than consent, in case of noncompliance with the LGPD;

  • Review of automated decisions made by deco solely based on automated processing of personal data that affect your interests.

The User must contact deco via the email or phone provided in the “General Provisions” section below if interested in exercising any of the rights listed above.

General Provisions

This Policy constitutes the valid and effective version of information on the processing of Users’ personal data by deco, except where services governed by their own privacy policies are used, in accordance with acquired rights, vested rights, and res judicata.

The version of the Policy in effect will always be the most recent. To identify the version in effect, you should check the “Last Updated” section at the top of this document.

Deco reserves the right to periodically update and modify any of its legal documents, including this Policy. Any modification to this Policy that impacts previously granted consent or imposes financial burdens on Users will be communicated by deco in advance. However, any changes made for legal reasons or due to new features of a Service will take effect immediately.

Deco is constantly seeking improvement to offer you the best possible experience when using the Services. However, the Services are offered “as is,” and deco may freely implement changes, modifications, additions, deletions, or any other alterations to the Solutions.

If the User does not agree with any changes to this Policy, the User must discontinue use of the Platform. Otherwise, continued use of the Platform and Services will constitute acknowledgment and acceptance of the new version of the Policy.

You may stop using the Services at any time. Likewise, deco may cease to provide the Services to you at any time, as well as impose or create limits on the Services. If you do not agree with any changes to this Policy, you must stop using the Services. Otherwise, continued use of the Services will constitute your acceptance of the new version of the Policy.

If the User wishes to exercise any of the rights set forth in this Policy or in applicable law, or has questions about this document and the practices described herein, the User should contact deco’s Data Protection Officer, Pedro Pereira, via email: legal@deco.cx

The User acknowledges that the particularities regarding the collection, use, and sharing of personal data and information by deco have been sufficiently described in this Policy and that deco has duly complied with its duty of information.

After carefully reading this Policy, the User agrees to and accepts all its provisions.
